Ltd. |line = {{GZM line links|2}} |Connections = |PlatformType = 1 [[Island platform]]<br>1 [[Side platform]] |Platform = 3 |Exit = |ExitNames = |stats = |statsnote = |services = {{s-rail|title=GZM}} {{s-line|system=GZM|line=2|previous=Jiangxia|next=Baiyun Culture Square}} }} '''Xiao-gang Station''' ({{zh|s=萧岗站}}), called '''Jiangxia Station''' ({{zh|s=江夏站}}) during planning, is a [[metro station]] of [[Guangzhou Metro]] [[Line 2, Guangzhou Metro|Line 2]] in [[Guangzhou]], [[China]]. It is located at the underground of the south of Huangshi Road East ({{zh|s=黄石东路|p=Huangshi Donglu}}), the east of Yuncheng Road West ({{zh|s=云城西路|p=Yuncheng Xilu}}) and the south of Xiaogang River ({{zh|s=萧岗涌|p=Xiaogang Chong}}), in [[Baiyun District, Guangzhou|Baiyun District]].<ref>[http://www.gzlive.net/guangzhou/29568.html 地铁二号线北延段新旧站名对比 (Chinese)]</ref> It started operation on 25 September 2010. The English station name is hyphenated to avoid confusion with the similarly named Xiaogang station on Line 8, which shares the same pinyin spelling but has a different tonal pronunciation and different characters. Xiao-gang Station is within walking distance of the [[Guangdong University of Foreign Studies]] north campus, as well as the west gate of [[Baiyun Mountain]]. ==Station layout== {|table border=0
